item.title: Ticket #2827 (Blog with Privacy setting enabled notifies Technorati) closed
item.dc:creator: matt
item.description:
wontfix:

It's not a tin-foil hat option. The incoming links feed doesn't mean your blog will be indexed. People who don't want it can edit the code or use a plugin, it's confusing to conflate these settings in core.

item.title: Ticket #2831 (Gzip support in class-snoopy.php) updated
item.dc:creator: masquerade
item.description: -1 for the patch in its current state. Can we not rely on sketchy functionality, like undefined constants defaulting to that value as a string? Also, I don't like the error triggered here, because we shouldn't trigger errors on something that isn't user customizable without altering a core file, unless it is a truly necessary feature.

item.dc:creator: Phantagom
item.description: class-snoopy.php laks gzip support, sometimes you need gzip support if you want to fetch a gzipped rss feed over http. So I made a patch thats ads gzip support to class-snoopy.php.

item.title: Ticket #2830 (Change the way t he domain is being retrieved for sending e-mails from ...) created
item.dc:creator: Woudloper
item.description:
On moment I have implemented Wordpress at ​my hosting provider in the Netherlands.

Last week they had send me an e-mail about new spam preventions they have taken as you can ​read hear (in Dutch).

What does this mean? This means that the e-mail from should be from an existing domain, but my weblog is placed in a subdomain as followed: 

http://weblog.domain.nl

The e-mail that is being generated from the pluggable function wp_mail is as followed: 

wordpress@weblog.domain.nl

The problem: The problem is, is that this isn't an existing mailaddress and thus the notifications of new comments, registrations, etc. aren't received to the to email address.

Suggestion/Solution: Couldn't it be made possible that the e-mail from for the wp_mail function can be made customizable e.g. via the options within the dashboard. This way I can put in an existing e-mail address.

Extra: See ​this reply on the forum of the hosting provider where they made a suggestion for the problem.

item.title: 2828.diff attached to Ticket #2828

item.description: any better ideas?

item.title: Ticket #2828 (Ease MySQL4.1 character set configuration) created
item.dc:creator: tenpura
item.description:
MySQL4.1 and later, character set configuration become complicated and this annoys people. The problem is that if the person has no permission to modify my.cnf, the only solution so far is to hardcode a MySQL query to the core file such as wp-db.php. This is not easy for everyone.
​http://www.google.com/search?hl=en&q=%22SET+NAMES%22+%22wp-db.php%22

Most people execute "SET NAMES 'utf8'" query right after the database connection is made. This will set session values of 4 MySQL system variables (character_set_client, character_set_connection, character_set_results, collation_connection) to utf8. In most cases this operation is necessary because these values default to latin1. The only solution I can think of is to control this from wp-config.php. (see attachment)

What I want to say is that this is everybody's issue including English users, because if one gets garbled UTF-8 international trackbacks or comments on his UTF-8 WP, that means his WP may be misconfigured.

item.title: Ticket #2827 (Blog with Privacy setting enabled notifies Technorati) updated
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description:
Milestone changed

I agree that if privacy is a core option it should turn off the Incoming Links feed.

item.title: Ticket #2827 (Blog with Privacy setting enabled notifies Technorati) created
item.dc:creator: Nazgul
item.description:
Although my blog has it's privacy settings set to not allow search engines, the main page of the Admin Dashboard still notifies Technorati of the existance of my blog by requesting incoming links.

I think the entire 'Incoming Links' section shouldn't be shown with privacy settings enabled. This then also slightly improves the performance of the index page.

What do you guys think?

item.title: Ticket #2714 (comments with HTML can wreck Moderation Queue window) updated
item.dc:creator: Nazgul
item.description:
Keywords changed

I got tired of dealing with this type of spam, so I coded a small fix and hope it's of use to somebody else as well.

Also, could somebody tell me what the $is_comment argument in the balanceTags function is used for? It isn't used in the function itself and none of the calling functions pass it in. Can't it be removed?

item.title: Ticket #2666 (WordPress shouldn't use URI instead of URL just because URI is geeky cool.) updated
item.dc:creator: Nazgul
item.description:
Keywords changed

I created a patch which changes all user visible references from URI to URL.

I've also taken the oportunity to add the abbr tag to all changed references that didn't have them yet.

And also +1.

item.title: Ticket #2701 (Centralize javascript inclusions) updated
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description:
arnee, I had assumed that plugins would just create their own dbx-key javascript to register and enqueue (de-registering or dequeuing the normal dbx-key if necessary).

I suppose plugins which use the same DBX groupings as the core does (something I had not considered) would benefit from your patch.

item.title: Ticket #2734 (Nonce confirmation not informative.) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description:
Ideally, verb noun pairs would map to a sentence that has the verb and noun hardcoded. 

__('Are you sure you want to delete category %s')

The nouns and verbs need the context of the entire sentence for proper translation. Also, we should move the nonce decoder and AYS dialog code to a separate function so that plugin writers don't have to reproduce all of that when providing a custom check_admin_referer(). I have to cut-and-paste all of that stuff into the secure-admin plugin even though I just want to add one line to the top of the function.

item.title: Ticket #2824 (Can't send pingbacks: Invalid pingback URI) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
Cannot duplicate on my server. If I submit blank or 0 to get_permalink(), I get ​http://example.com/2006/06/15//

No clue how you're getting that date... has to be something in get_permalink() that's screwing up.

item.title: Ticket #2825 (Category Exclusion for real) updated
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description:
Keywords changed

Attached patch true-cat-exclusion.diff ensures all posts in the excluded categories are excluded. It costs one query. This will help folks with asides or other kinds of multiple-loop systems.

item.title: Ticket #2825 (Category Exclusion for real) created
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description: Query vars like "cat=-1" will exclude all posts with ONLY category 1. Posts severally categorized cannot be excluded by category.
